availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John T. Viley (Scott and Fayette County, KY)

body.p: Residence: Lexington post office, Fayette County, Kentucky. (No occupation yet in the 1860 census). Born in Scott County, Kentucky, son of John Rodes Viley and Mary S. Johnson. (John Rodes Viley was brother of Ann Eliza Viley, who married George Washington Johnson).

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, Lexington post office, p. 24.

Find A Grave, Entry for John T. Viley (1845-1924), Find A Grave Memorial # 127684717, Lexington Cemetery, Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=viley&GSfn=john+&GSmn=t&GSbyrel=all&GSdyrel=all&GSob=n&GRid=127684717&df=all& (accessed 9 Aug 2017).
